Sisli district is the important area in Istanbul, as it is the area of money, banks and businessmen.

In addition to the Sultan Ayoub region, the historical region of Islamic character, it includes the tomb of the great companion Abu Ayoub Al-Ansari, to whom the name of the region is attributed.

Tourism in Beyoglu, Istanbul

We also talked about the fact that the Beyoglu district of Istanbul is one of the tourist areas par excellence, due to the availability of many tourist places and vital centers in it, and perhaps the most important of these places are:

Galata Tower Which is considered one of the oldest and most beautiful towers in Turkey, historically dating back more than 1,500 years. It is located in the Galata region in Istanbul, north of the Golden Horn. It is considered an important archaeological landmark in the Beyoglu region of Istanbul. It provides a distinctive view of the historical Istanbul peninsula, in addition to that it paints a panoramic painting on the city of Istanbul from A height of 67 meters, of great beauty, which is visited by thousands of local visitors and tourists from various countries of the world, to enjoy this wonderful painting.

Museum of Modern Art Istanbul Museum of Contemporary and Modern Art This museum is considered one of the most important museums in Istanbul, as it reflects the ancient Turkish civilization in the past, present and future. Many fans of drawings and sculptures.

Mina Turk A museum and garden located in the center of Istanbul in the Beyoglu district of Istanbul on the banks of the Golden Horn Bay and is considered one of the most important tourist places in Istanbul visited by hundreds of thousands of tourists annually. And Islamic, such as a model of Al-Aqsa Mosque and a model of the Dome of the Rock, in addition to the electric city for children's games.

Pera Museum Which is considered an art museum concerned with oriental art and includes a collection of orientalist paintings by European, Turkish and Ottoman artists, such as the famous painting by the Ottoman artist Osman Hamdi Bey (Turtle Coach). The museum hosts international exhibitions and various types of Anatolian artifacts.

Istiklal Street It serves as the aorta in Istanbul and is the main nerve in the Beyoglu region. Its length is about 3 km. It includes hundreds of restaurants, cafes, and shops with local and international brands, in addition to gaming cities and cinemas.

Galata Mevlevi Museum It is considered one of the important museums in Istanbul and this museum provides important information about the Islamic culture, music and traditions of the Mevlevi.

Taksim Square It includes the Statue of the Republic, which is a memorial monument located at a height of 11 meters in the middle of Taksim Square. Taksim Square is a destination for many tourists, as many popular festivals, important presidential speeches and national celebrations are held in it.

Tophane Fountain It is the tallest fountain in Istanbul built in the Ottoman style.

Qamar Hatun Mosque It is distinguished by its wide area, stone walls, wooden ceiling, and turquoise ceramic tiles around its windows, and its name is attributed to the nurse of the Ottoman Sultan Selim I.

flower aisle It is one of the most beautiful tourist places in Istanbul, as it was a street selling beautiful flowers, and today it is full of restaurants and cafes that offer delicious food and delicious foods.

Robinson Beyoglu Library It is one of the oldest libraries located on Istiklal Street. It includes many books, publications, and various novels.
